text:
Today we celebrate the centennial of the birth of jazz music icon Charlie Parker. He was a phenomenal musician who, against all odds, single-handedly transformed our conception of what jazz could be. 

https://t.co/VOgDjpmIRJ

name: thedailybeast
text:
“Music is your own experience, your thoughts, your wisdom,” said Charlie Parker. “If you don’t live it, it won’t come out of your horn. They teach you there’s a boundary line to music. But man, there’s no boundary line to art.”

https://t.co/ACG3d9UxMW

name: thedailybeast
text:
Jazz writer Stanley Crouch wrote about the genius of the musician universally known as Bird, and had invaluable insights to offer into the meaning of Parker’s achievements.
